FuncDef:
The encapsulate-ring-id enable command enables the function of encapsulating a ring network ID into the destination MAC address of ERPS packets.
The undo encapsulate-ring-id enable command disables the function of encapsulating a ring network ID into the destination MAC address of ERPS packets. The encapsulate-ring-id enable command enables the function of encapsulating a ring network ID into the destination MAC address of ERPS packets. The undo encapsulate-ring-id enable command disables the function of encapsulating a ring network ID into the destination MAC address of ERPS packets. By default, the function of encapsulating a ring network ID into the destination MAC address of ERPS packets is disabled. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K and CE6820S.
ExtraInfo: When a Huawei device communicates with a non-Huawei device, if the destination MAC address of ERPS packets sent by the non-Huawei device carries a ring network ID, the Huawei device cannot communicate with the non-Huawei device. In this case, you need to run this command to enable the function of encapsulating a ring network ID into the destination MAC address of ERPS packets, so that the Huawei device can communicate with the non-Huawei device.
